page.title: 15ALLESLEY HALL
page.content:
A house has existed in Allesley Park since the 17th century although tradition suggests that a castle originally stood on the site, but was destroyed by fire in 1146.
Thomas Flynn built the first (Allesley Hall) on the present site in 1660. His wife, who inherited the hall, sold everything including the hall, the park and property in the village of Allesley to Henry Neale in 1692. Neale added a new entrance and drive to the hall. Later the hall became a boys' boarding school.
At the beginning of this century the hall was in possession of the Iliffe family. In 1910 W. Iliffe altered the house considerably with the addition of gables and chimneys.
